member.name: T:Cudafy.CudafyAttribute
member.summary: Static methods, static fields and structures to be converted to CUDA C should be decorated with this attribute.

member.summary: Gets the type of the cudafy attribute.

member.name: T:Cudafy.CudafyDummyAttribute
member.summary: Methods, structures and fields that already have an equivalent in Cuda C should be decorated with this attribute. The item should have the same name and be in a CUDA C (.cu) file of the same name unless specified.

member.name: M:Cudafy.CudafyDummyAttribute.#ctor(Cudafy.eCudafyType,Cudafy.eCudafyDummyBehaviour)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: If set to Suppress then do not include CUDA C file of the same name.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets the behaviour.

member.name: P:Cudafy.CudafyDummyAttribute.SupportsEmulation
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether supports emulation.
member.value: true if supports emulation; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Informs the CudafyTranslator to ignore the member of a struct.

member.name: T:Cudafy.CudafyAddressSpaceAttribute
member.summary: Placed on parameters to indicate the OpenCL address space. Note that if not specified then arrays will automatically be marked global. Ignored when translating to CUDA.

member.summary: Optionally placed on methods to indicate whether the method should be inlined or not.

member.summary: Gets the embedded cudafy module from the assembly.

member.summary: Cudafies the assembly producing a *.cdfy file with same name as assembly. Architecture is 2.0.
member.returns: Output messages of the cudafycl.exe process.

member.summary: Tries cudafying the assembly producing a *.cdfy file with same name as assembly. Architecture is 2.0.

member.summary: Tries cudafying the assembly producing a *.cdfy file with same name as assembly. Architecture is 2.0.
member.param: Output messages of the cudafycl.exe process.

member.summary: NOTE: Compute Capability 3.5 and later only. Dynamic parallelism. Call from a single thread. Not supported by emulator.

member.summary: Synchronizes threads.

member.name: T:Cudafy.IntegerIntrinsics.IntegerIntrinsicsFunctions
member.summary: Extension class containing Integer Intrinsics functions.

member.name: M:Cudafy.IntegerIntrinsics.IntegerIntrinsicsFunctions.popcount(Cudafy.GThread,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Count the number of bits that are set to 1 in x.
member.returns: Returns a value between 0 and 32 inclusive representing the number of set bits.

member.name: M:Cudafy.IntegerIntrinsics.IntegerIntrinsicsFunctions.popcountll(Cudafy.GThread,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Count the number of bits that are set to 1 in x.
member.returns: Returns a value between 0 and 64 inclusive representing the number of set bits.

member.name: M:Cudafy.IntegerIntrinsics.IntegerIntrinsicsFunctions.clz(Cudafy.GThread,System.Int32)
member.summary: Count the number of consecutive leading zero bits, starting at the most significant bit (bit 31) of x.
member.returns: Returns a value between 0 and 32 inclusive representing the number of zero bits.

member.name: M:Cudafy.IntegerIntrinsics.IntegerIntrinsicsFunctions.clzll(Cudafy.GThread,System.Int64)
member.summary: Count the number of consecutive leading zero bits, starting at the most significant bit (bit 63) of x.
member.returns: Returns a value between 0 and 64 inclusive representing the number of zero bits.

member.name: M:Cudafy.IntegerIntrinsics.IntegerIntrinsicsFunctions.mul24(Cudafy.GThread,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the least significant 32 bits of the product of the least significant 24 bits of x and y. The high order 8 bits of x and y are ignored.

member.name: M:Cudafy.IntegerIntrinsics.IntegerIntrinsicsFunctions.umul24(Cudafy.GThread,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Calculate the least significant 32 bits of the product of the least significant 24 bits of x and y. The high order 8 bits of x and y are ignored.

member.name: M:Cudafy.IntegerIntrinsics.IntegerIntrinsicsFunctions.mul64hi(Cudafy.GThread,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Calculate the most significant 64 bits of the 128-bit product x * y, where x and y are 64-bit integers.
member.returns: Returns the most significant 64 bits of the product x * y.

member.name: M:Cudafy.IntegerIntrinsics.IntegerIntrinsicsFunctions.mulhi(Cudafy.GThread,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the most significant 32 bits of the 64-bit product x * y, where x and y are 32-bit integers.
member.returns: Returns the most significant 32 bits of the product x * y.

member.name: M:Cudafy.IntegerIntrinsics.IntegerIntrinsicsFunctions.umul64hi(Cudafy.GThread,System.UInt64,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Calculate the most significant 64 bits of the 128-bit product x * y, where x and y are 64-bit integers.
member.returns: Returns the most significant 64 bits of the product x * y.

member.name: M:Cudafy.IntegerIntrinsics.IntegerIntrinsicsFunctions.umulhi(Cudafy.GThread,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Calculate the most significant 32 bits of the 64-bit product x * y, where x and y are 32-bit integers.
member.returns: Returns the most significant 32 bits of the product x * y.

member.name: T:Cudafy.GMath
member.summary: Many of the .NET math methods are double only. When single point (float) is used this results in an unwanted cast to double.

member.name: F:Cudafy.GMath.PI
member.summary: Represents the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter, specified by the constant, .

member.name: F:Cudafy.GMath.E
member.summary: Represents the natural logarithmic base, specified by the constant, e.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Abs(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the absolute value of a single precision floating point number. For OpenCL compatibility, first cast value to an integer.
member.param: The value to find absolute value of.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Abs(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the absolute value of a single precision floating point number. For OpenCL compatibility, first cast value to an integer.
member.param: The value to find absolute value of.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Abs(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns the absolute value of a single precision floating point number. For OpenCL compatibility, first cast value to an integer.
member.param: The value to find absolute value of.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Sqrt(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the square root of a specified number.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Cos(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the cosine of the specified angle.
member.returns: The cosine of value. If value is equal to NaN, NegativeInfinity, or PositiveInfinity, this method returns NaN.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Acos(System.Single)
member.summary: Acoses the specified value.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Cosh(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of the specified angle.
member.returns: The hyperbolic cosine of value. If value is equal to NegativeInfinity or PositiveInfinity, PositiveInfinity is returned. If value is equal to NaN, NaN is returned.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Sin(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the sine of the specified angle.
member.returns: The sine of value. If value is equal to NaN, NegativeInfinity, or PositiveInfinity, this method returns NaN.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Asin(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the sine of the specified angle.
member.returns: The sine of value. If value is equal to NaN, NegativeInfinity, or PositiveInfinity, this method returns NaN.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Sinh(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the hyperbolic sine of the specified angle.
member.returns: The hyperbolic sine of value. If value is equal to NaN, NegativeInfinity, or PositiveInfinity, this method returns NaN.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Tan(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the tan of the specified angle.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Atan(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the tan of the specified angle.

member.summary: Returns the angle whose tangent is the quotient of two specified numbers.
member.param: The y coordinate of a point.
The x coordinate of a point.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Tanh(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns hyperbolic the tangent of the specified angle.
member.returns: The hyperbolic the tangent of value.

member.summary: Rounds the specified value.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Ceiling(System.Single)
member.summary: Ceilings the specified value.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Floor(System.Single)
member.summary: Floors the specified value.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Pow(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the specified number raised to the specified power.
member.param: Number to be raised to a power.
member.returns: X to the power of y.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Log10(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the base 10 log of the specified number.
member.param: A number whose logarithm is to be found.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Log(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the natural (base e) logarithm of a specified number.
member.param: A number whose logarithm is to be found.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GMath.Exp(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns e raised to the specified power.
member.returns: The number e raised to the power d. If d equals NaN or PositiveInfinity, that value is returned. If d equals NegativeInfinity, 0 is returned.

member.summary: Truncates the specified value.

member.summary: Returns the smaller of two single float precision numbers.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GThread.InsertCode(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts CUDA C code directly into kernel. Example: thread.InsertCode("#pragma unroll 5");
member.exception: Attempt to run code through emulator made.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GThread.InsertCode(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts CUDA C code directly into kernel. Example: thread.InsertCode("#pragma unroll 5", false);
member.param: If true (default) then throw an exception if emulation is attempted.
member.exception: Attempt to run code through emulator made while throwIfNotSupported is true.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GThread.InsertCode(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Inserts CUDA C code directly into kernel. Example: thread.InsertCode("{0}[{2}] = {1}[{2}];", results, data, index);
member.param: Replaces place holders with names of one or more arguments.
member.exception: Attempt to run code through emulator made.

member.name: M:Cudafy.GThread.InsertCode(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Object[])
member.summary: Inserts CUDA C code directly into kernel. Example: thread.InsertCode("{0}[{2}] = {1}[{2}];", results, data, index);
member.param: If true (default) then throw an exception if emulation is attempted.
Replaces place holders with names of one or more arguments.
member.exception: Attempt to run code through emulator made while throwIfNotSupported is true.

members.member:
* Allows multiple threads to gather at a point before proceeding.
*
* @author Thomas W. Christopher (Tools of Computing LLC)
* @version 0.2 Beta
* Number of threads that still must gather.
* Number of threads that still must gather.
* Total number of threads that must gather.

* Creates a Barrier at which n threads may repeatedly gather.
*
* @param n total number of threads that must gather.

* Is called by a thread to wait for the rest of the n threads to gather
* before the set of threads may continue executing.
*
* @throws InterruptedException If interrupted while waiting.

member.name: M:info.jhpc.thread.SimpleBarrier.SignalAndWait
member.summary: Calls gather();

member.name: M:info.jhpc.thread.SimpleBarrier.SignalAndWaitAndCountPredicate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calls gather(predicate); Returns sum of true predicates within block

member.summary: Calls gather();

member.summary: Calls gather();

member.summary: Calls gather();
